content:
Cakebrew is a simple App to help in the management of Homebrew formulas. It lets the user do most of the tasks that Homebrew performs, but does so in a nice GUI instead of the terminal.

In this app a heavy use of concurrent threads was required for running the homebrew tasks without blocking the UI. It has ever since gathered a large amout of users and many developers have contributed to the codebase from GitHub.

To check out the GitHub repository or to download the App, please visit its website.

Development-to-Release time: 2 weeks
subtitle: Open-source App for Homebrew management.
title: Cakebrew

content:
Noto is a simple plain text editor written entirelly in Swift.

It is a complete rewrite of a previous project of mine, TipTyper, which was written in Objective-C.

Noto is a lot simpler but still has many features focused in productivity. In short, it is a text editor that combines all the small features I needed in a single package.

The initial developement time was about two months, and the first release was in June 2017.
subtitle: Simple plain text editor for macOS written in Swift.
title: Noto

content:
tune is a simple command line application to control iTunes. With it you can search for tracks and play them, check the current track, skip, pause, stop, and etc. It uses ncurses and ScriptingBridge. It is still being worked on every now and then.

For more information visit its repo on GitHub.
subtitle: Console tool to control iTunes.
title: tune

content:
An experiment to evaluate how complicated it would be to write an Apple Watch app that behaves like a watch face and that simulates a Nixie-tube watch (kinda like the one Steve Wozniak uses).

Unfortunately Apps that emulate Apple Watch Faces are vetoed by Apple, so this won't be in the App Store any time soon...

Apple Watch mockup from MediaLoot.
subtitle: Nixie tube face app for Apple Watch.
title: NixieWatch

content:
An experiment to evaluate how complicated it would be to write an iPod simulator that actually plays music. It uses the Audio library of the device it is running from (therefore won't run properly in a simulator).

Unfortunately Apps that emulate an iPod are vetoed by Apple (guess how many people must have tried that already), so this won't be in the App Store any time soon...

iPod touch mockup by @nola_will.
subtitle: Working iPod Classic simulator for iOS
title: TapWheel

content:
This is a simple BTC and LTC wallet ticker App for iPhone, iPad, iPod touch and Apple Watch. It displays the current balance of your addresses and the latest prices from the local brazilian exchange "Mercado Bitcoin".

The Apple Watch app is a simple version of the app that displays the prices of BTC and LTC, and the balance of your addresses. As a convenience, it can also display a QR code to any of the addresses.
subtitle: BTC and LTC ticker app with support for Apple Watch.
title: Ticker Mercado BTC

content:
x2048 is a puzzle game for iPhone, iPad and iPod touch. It is a version of the popular 2048 game, but on an hexagonal board.

It was my first proper game for iOS. It was made using Apple's SpriteKit. One of the main challenges was creating the recursive algorithm that calculates the movement for each disc, detecting discs movements and merges.

Development-to-Release time: 3 weeks
subtitle: Puzzle game for iPhone, iPod touch and iPad.
title: x2048

content:
This is a simple companion app I developed for the world popular geek event called Campus Party — more precisely, for the 2014 Brazilian edition.

The App displays: a calendar of all presentations and talks schedulled to happen, ordered by day and hour with search support; A news directory with data pulled from the event's official blog; A composite map of the convention center where the event will be held and its interior; and some extra info, like a functionality to open the Maps App to display the shortest route to the location.

I learned a lot about remote requests on iOS, handling connections, erros and unexpected outputs. The automatic content update functionality involves compressions and handling this task was also a new challenge for me.

The App is currently available on the App Store. For more information, please visit the App's hot site (in Portuguese).

Development-to-Release time: 3 weeks
subtitle: Companion app for the Campus Party Brazil 2014.
title: Agenda #cpbr7

content:
'Is It Down?' is a simple but useful widget for the iOS Notification Center. It was my very first widget for iOS, and a WatchKit companion is already in the works.

With this tiny tool, you are able to monitor the status of your favorite websites. This is the perfect tool for Webmasters!

Development-to-Release time: 1 week
subtitle: Website status monitor widget for iOS.
title: Is It Down?

content:
HomeBoxer generates simple but elegant static websites with little effort. It is all done from a simple user interface, without the input of real files.

The user simply inputs text on an inline editor with lines counter and helps the user inserting files or images with a resource manager.

For more information, visit its website.

Development-to-Release time: 1 week
subtitle: Simple static websites generator that uses Markdown or HTML input.
title: HomeBoxer

content:
autobash is a simple library tool to help you store and run bash files.

Instead of memorizing the path of bash files, simply call autobash followed by the name of the file to run it. For example: I use it to retreive certain web files to different folders by simply calling autobash retreive.

For more information, visit its website.
subtitle: Console tool to assist in the execution of bash files.
title: autobash
